p: It is well known that serine proteases participate in the process of internalization of coronaviruses and influenza A viruses into the epithelial cells (Simmons 2013; Garten et al. 2015). The activity of trypsin-like proteinases in the upper respiratory tract significantly depends on the activity of inhibitors of secretory leucoproteinases and in the lower respiratory tract it depends on the surfactant (Kido et al. 2004). Therefore, therapeutics that induce the expression of inhibitors of secretory leucoproteinases and surfactant may significantly inhibit the multicyclic replication of RNA viruses (including influenza and coronaviruses).
